extension.name: ChronometricDate
extension.dc:description: Extension to Occurrence Core to capture chronometric dating information.

property.name: chronometricDateID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the set of information associated with a ChronometricDate. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.
property.examples: GUID reference to the combination of information for one ChronometricDate.

property.name: verbatimChronometricAge
property.dc:description: The verbatim age for a specimen, whether reported by a dating assay, associated references, or legacy information. For example, this could be the conventional radiocarbon age as given in an AMS dating report. This could also be simply what is reported as the age of a specimen in legacy collections data.

property.name: verbatimChronometricAgeConversionProtocol
property.dc:description: The method used for converting the verbatimChronometricAge into a chronometric date in years, as captured in the maximumChronometricAge, maximumChronometricAgeReferenceSystem, minimumChronometricAge, and minimumChronometricAgeReferenceSystem fields. For example, calibration of conventional radiocarbon age or the currently accepted age range of a cultural or geological period.

property.name: maximumChronometricAge
property.dc:description: Upper limit for the age of a specimen as determined by a dating method.

property.name: maximumChronometricAgeReferenceSystem
property.dc:description: The reference system associated with the maximumChronometricAge. For example, BC. The unit for this field is years.

property.name: minimumChronometricAge
property.dc:description: Lower limit for the age of a specimen as determined by a dating method.

property.name: minimumChronometricAgeReferenceSystem
property.dc:description: The reference system associated with the minimumChronometricAge. For example, AD. The unit for this field is years.

property.name: chronometricAgeUncertaintyInYears
property.dc:description: The temporal uncertainty of the maximumAge and minimumAge, in years.

property.name: chronometricAgeUncertaintyMethod
property.dc:description: The method used to generate the reported uncertainty calculations.

property.name: materialDated
property.dc:description: A description of the material on which the chronometricDateProtocol was actually performed, if known.

property.name: materialDatedID
property.dc:description: An identifier for the material on which the chronometricDateProtocol was performed, if applicable.
property.examples: If the material dated is not the sample itself (or even to clarify if it is), an identifier can be given.

property.name: chronometricDateProtocol
property.dc:description: A description or reference to the methods used to determine the ChronometricDate.

property.name: chronometricDateReferences
property.dc:description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the ChronometricDate.

property.name: chronometricDateRemarks
property.dc:description: Notes or comments about the ChronometricDate.
